regulatory.title: Chairman Fuchs Provides Updates on Outstanding Proceedings
regulatory.summary: Surface Transportation Board Chairman Patrick Fuchs provided an update today on recent actions to facilitate and expedite the resolution of several outstanding Board proceedings. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: Surface Transportation Board Chairman Patrick Fuchs provided an update today on recent actions to facilitate and expedite the resolution of several outstanding Board proceedings. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: Public Advisory Regarding Partial Lapse in Appropriations
regulatory.summary: Due to a lapse in appropriations causing the federal government to partially shut down its operations, Surface Transportation Board (STB) functions will be suspended. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: Due to a lapse in appropriations causing the federal government to partially shut down its operations, Surface Transportation Board (STB) functions will be suspended. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: STB Finds UP-NS Merger Application is Incomplete
regulatory.summary: The STB today announced a unanimous decision finding that the major merger application filed by Union Pacific (UP) and Norfolk Southern (NS) on December 19, 2025 is incomplete. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: The STB today announced a unanimous decision finding that the major merger application filed by Union Pacific (UP) and Norfolk Southern (NS) on December 19, 2025 is incomplete. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: STB Proposes to Eliminate Barriers to Competition by Repealing Regulations at 49 C.F.R. Part 1144
regulatory.summary: The Surface Transportation Board (STB or Board) today announced a unanimous decision proposing a significant pro-competitive action: repeal of 49 C.F.R. part 1144, which governs the prescription of reciprocal switching, through routes, and through rates. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: The Surface Transportation Board (STB or Board) today announced a unanimous decision proposing a significant pro-competitive action: repeal of 49 C.F.R. part 1144, which governs the prescription of reciprocal switching, through routes, and through rates. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: STB Receives Major Merger Application from Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern; Sets Deadline for Comments on Completeness
regulatory.summary: The Surface Transportation Board today announced that it has received a major merger application from Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: The Surface Transportation Board today announced that it has received a major merger application from Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: Michelle A. Schultz Confirmed to Second Term
regulatory.summary: On December 18, 2025, the U.S. Senate confirmed the nomination of Michelle A. Schultz to a second term as a member of the Surface Transportation Board. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: On December 18, 2025, the U.S. Senate confirmed the nomination of Michelle A. Schultz to a second term as a member of the Surface Transportation Board. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: STB Approves Fortress Investment Group Acquisition of Two Shortline Rail Carriers
regulatory.summary: The Surface Transportation Board today announced it has granted authority for Fortress Investment Group LLC (Fortress) to acquire control of Wheeling & Lake Erie Railway Company (W&LE) and Akron Barberton Cluster Railway Company (ABC). [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: The Surface Transportation Board today announced it has granted authority for Fortress Investment Group LLC (Fortress) to acquire control of Wheeling & Lake Erie Railway Company (W&LE) and Akron Barberton Cluster Railway Company (ABC). [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: Public Advisory Regarding Materials Previously Due to the Surface Transportation Board During Recent Lapse in Appropriations
regulatory.summary: The Surface Transportation Board (STB or Board) today announced that it has issued a decision providing notice that materials that were due to be submitted to the Board during the recent lapse in appropriations are now due no later than November 20, 2025. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: The Surface Transportation Board (STB or Board) today announced that it has issued a decision providing notice that materials that were due to be submitted to the Board during the recent lapse in appropriations are now due no later than November 20, 2025. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: Public Advisory Regarding Lapse in Appropriations
regulatory.summary: Due to a lapse in appropriations causing the federal government to partially shut down its operations, Surface Transportation Board (STB) functions will be suspended. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: Due to a lapse in appropriations causing the federal government to partially shut down its operations, Surface Transportation Board (STB) functions will be suspended. [Click for full press release.]

regulatory.title: STB Proposes to Eliminate Unneeded Data Collection and Strengthen Service Reliability Oversight as Part of Broader Data Modernization Initiative
regulatory.summary: The Surface Transportation Board today issued a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) to streamline and improve reporting requirements for Class I rail carriers, proposing to eliminate the now-unnecessary supplemental reporting of Positive Train Control (PTC) expenditures and proposing to require the reporting of two critical metrics for the Boards objective to ensure rail service reliability. [Click for full press release.]
regulatory.content: The Surface Transportation Board today issued a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) to streamline and improve reporting requirements for Class I rail carriers, proposing to eliminate the now-unnecessary supplemental reporting of Positive Train Control (PTC) expenditures and proposing to require the reporting of two critical metrics for the Boards objective to ensure rail service reliability. [Click for full press release.]
